--- title: "In Class Exercise 6" author: "Sei Sar Hla Kyi" date: "30 September 2024" date-modified: "2024-09-30" execute: eval: true echo: true message: false freeze: true warning: false --- # Emerging Hot Spot Analysis - Change according to time - Spatio-temporal analysis method to reveal and describe how hotspot evolve over time. ## Load packages ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} pacman::p_load(dplyr,sf, sfdep, tmap, plotly, tidyverse) ``` ::: ## Import Geospatial Data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} hunan <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", layer = "Hunan") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Reading layer `Hunan' from data source `/Users/seesarhlakyi/Desktop/ssrhk/ISSS626-GAA/In-class_Ex/In-class_Ex06/data/geospatial' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' Simple feature collection with 88 features and 7 fields Geometry type: POLYGON Dimension: XY Bounding box: xmin: 108.7831 ymin: 24.6342 xmax: 114.2544 ymax: 30.12812 Geodetic CRS: WGS 84 ``` ::: ::: ## Import Aspatial Data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} GDPPC <- read_csv("data/aspatial/Hunan_GDPPC.csv") ``` ::: ## Creating Time Series Cube - tidyverse r object - 3D data, only useful when space dimension is constant CANNOT handle dynamic spacetime. - If boundary change (e.g. forest fire), CANNOT use. - ONLY attribute change over time. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} GDPPC_st <- spacetime(GDPPC, hunan, .loc_col = "County", .time_col = "Year") ``` ::: Cannot use original time/date field since it is not integer. Convert date into integer for .time_col. lubridate for the number ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} is_spacetime_cube(GDPPC_st) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] TRUE ``` ::: ::: ## Computing Gi\* ### Deriving spatial weights ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} GDPPC_nb <- GDPPC_st %>% activate("geometry") %>% mutate (nb = include_self( st_contiguity(geometry)), wt = st_inverse_distance(nb, geometry, scale = 1, alpha = 1), .before = 1) %>% set_nbs("nb") %>% set_wts("wt") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gi_stars <- GDPPC_nb %>% group_by(Year) %>% mutate(gi_star = local_gstar_perm( GDPPC,nb,wt)) %>% tidyr::unnest(gi_star) #Unnest to flatten it into datatable form ``` ::: ## Mann Kendall Test - perform analysis on individual area - function that only increase(or decrease) and never changes direction. - Ho: No monotonic trend - H1: Monotonic trend is present ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} cbg <- gi_stars %>% ungroup() %>% #It is a cube, need to pick out filter (County == "Changsha") %>% select (County, Year, gi_star) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(data = cbg, aes(x= Year, y= gi_star))+ geom_line()+ theme_light() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](In-class_Ex06_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Interactive Man Kendall Plot ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} p <- ggplot (data= cbg, aes( x= Year, y= gi_star))+ geom_line()+ theme_light() ggplotly(p) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ### Printing Man Kendall test report ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} cbg %>% summarise(mk = list( unclass( Kendall::MannKendall(gi_star))))%>% tidyr::unnest_wider(mk) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 × 5 tau sl S D varS 1 0.485 0.00742 66 136. 589. ``` ::: ::: sl is the p-value. 0.0074 is less than 0.05 reject null hypothesis. ### Mann-Kendall test data.frame - for all locations ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ehsa <- gi_stars %>% group_by (County) %>% summarise (mk = list( unclass( Kendall::MannKendall(gi_star)))) %>% tidyr::unnest_wider(mk) head(ehsa) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 × 6 County tau sl S D varS 1 Anhua 0.191 0.303 26 136. 589. 2 Anren -0.294 0.108 -40 136. 589. 3 Anxiang 0 1 0 136. 589. 4 Baojing -0.691 0.000128 -94 136. 589. 5 Chaling -0.0882 0.650 -12 136. 589. 6 Changning -0.750 0.0000318 -102 136. 589. ``` ::: ::: ::: callout-note ## After viewing this, plot some of the locations using the code chunk above to see what the relationship is like. See positive increasing trend and negative. ::: ## Performing Emerging Hotspot Analysis to be more sure of the classification that we labeled from Mann Kendall. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ehsa <- emerging_hotspot_analysis( x= GDPPC_st, .var= "GDPPC", k = 1, nsim =99 ) ``` ::: ::: callout-note ## There will be a classification column added. ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(data =ehsa, aes(x = classification)) + geom_bar() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](In-class_Ex06_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} hunan_ehsa <- hunan %>% left_join(ehsa, by = join_by(County==location)) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ehsa_sig <- hunan_ehsa %>% filter(p_value <0.05) tmap_mode('plot') tm_shape(hunan_ehsa)+ tm_polygons()+ tm_borders(alpha =0.5)+ tm_shape(ehsa_sig)+ tm_fill("classification") + tm_borders(alpha =0.5) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](In-class_Ex06_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Backtrack interpretation from here and talk about mann kendall test plot. Use emerging hotspot pvalue as there is simulations
